articles.title: Palate Cleanse: Paws and Enjoy Video of AI Cats Taking Over a McDonald's That Looks Totally Fur Real
articles.author: Warren Squire
articles.summary: AI has finally delivered what people have been clamoring for - realistic cats working at McDonald's. The cats are adorable, but some people are concerned about their food safety and the fact that they don't wear proper food safety gloves. Other posters are worried about the AI felines taking the jobs of humans.

articles.title: Singapore looks to AI to help manage the health of its fast-aging population
articles.author: Lucy Handley
articles.summary: By 2030, a quarter of Singaporeans will be 65 or older. Around 6,000 nurses and care staff will need to be hired annually to meet Singapore's health workforce targets. Sensi.AI is a U.S. company that monitors elderly people using audio devices that are usually plugged into three areas of their homes. The company is in discussions about expansion in Asia.

articles.title: A conversation with Chat GPT
articles.author: Robin Westenra
articles.summary: Rick Wiles reports from the mobile conference in Madrid that the tech optimism had dissipated and all the talk was no longer about cell phones and 5G but about AI. Robert Westenra has written about the importance of a thread on X last week that emphasised similar worries.

articles.title: Texas lawmaker introduces bill to limit AI in health insurance claims, gaining support from local doctors
articles.author: Allison Hill
articles.summary: State Rep. David Spiller has introduced House Bill 2922 to limit the use of artificial intelligence in health insurance claims. Spiller claims the bill is necessary to protect patients and ensure their medical care is guided by doctors. Dr. Scott Hecox, an orthopedic hand surgeon, believes AI-driven decisions can negatively impact patient care. Arizona and California have already passed measures to limit AI's role in processing claims.

articles.title: 5 Ways AI Can Supercharge Your Productivity At Work
articles.author: Caroline Castrillon
articles.summary: AI can increase a highly skilled worker's productivity at work by nearly 40%. It can be used strategically to boost productivity. AI can be a powerful tool when facing creative blocks or complex problems. It can help you overcome these challenges by suggesting ideas based on your input and refining initial concepts.

articles.title: Investment Manager Explains Why He's Buying Arista Networks (ANET) — ‘We Continue to Get Good News'
articles.author: Fahad Saleem
articles.summary: Arista Networks Inc (NYSE:ANET) is one of the top 10 stocks analysts are watching as AI selloff deepens. AI stocks are struggling to gain traction as investors rethink their strategies amid concerns of a slowdown in spending. Gene Munster, Deepwater Asset Management managing partner, believes we have two years of the AI bull run before the bubble bursts.

articles.title: Nobel Prizes and The AI Hype Hall of Fame
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: Geoff Hinton, Jack Clark and Dario Amodei predicted that AI systems will be smarter than Nobel Laureates by 2026 or 2027. I think this is absurd beyond words. Human scientists will get plenty of leverage from AI, but they won't be able to execute Nobel-caliber work on their own.

articles.title: Thread by @abcdentminded on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: AI will be great once it is advanced enough to be precisely prompted down to the deepest levels of detail. AI will never participate in the historical development of art any more than a pencil. AI is being used to automate creative work as well as technical work right now.

articles.title: Admiral Ackbar warns about EZ Pass text messages
articles.summary: AI could be used to automatically delete scam texts/emails/calls. The phone company could do it without AI, by asking the phone company if the number sending it belongs to the company in it and not just to the person sending the message.

articles.title: How to use ChatGPT to create images in iMessage
articles.author: Roger Fingas
articles.summary: Image Playground is an image generation app for your iPhone. It's mostly geared towards producing "fun" images of friends and family in a narrow style. Apple Intelligence's ChatGPT integration allows you to create more advanced images. The most important requirement is an iPhone that supports Apple Intelligence and updates to iOS 18.2.

articles.title: What do you think of Google's AI Overviews after nearly a year?
articles.author: Will Sattelberg
articles.summary: A year ago, Google launched AI Overviews, a tool that distills information from the internet into a simple sentence or two. Since then, the tool has been surrounded by controversy. Google doesn't allow you to disable it, but amending your URLs or bookmarked search engines can get you around it.

articles.title: Westfield Teen Fighting for Online Protections Finds Time to Fence in Junior Olympics
articles.summary: Francesca Mani attended the TIME100 AI Impact Awards ceremony in Dubai. She was named one of the 100 most influential people in AI. The 16-year-old was also competing at the Junior Olympics fencing event in Charlotte, North Carolina. The Take It Down Act, introduced by Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, passed the Senate in a bipartisan vote.

articles.title: AI race demands nuclear rethink
articles.author: Harun Talha
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has become a focal point in global strategic competition. US President Donald Trump's second term began with the launch of the US$500 billion Stargate AI initiative aimed at AI. Harun Talha Ayanoglu is a Turkish journalist.

articles.title: Amazon now testing AI-aided dubbing for some movies and series on Prime
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: Amazon is testing artificial intelligence-aided dubbing for select movies and shows offered on its Prime streaming service. The service will be in English and Latin American Spanish. Initially, it will be offered for 12 licensed titles. Other tech companies have introduced AI-powered dubbing into their platforms.

articles.title: What one Finnish church learned from creating a service almost entirely with AI
articles.author: DASHA LITVINOVA
articles.summary: It was the first church service in Finland put together mostly by AI tools, which wrote the sermons and some of the songs, composed the music and created the visuals. The service drew over 120 people to St. Paul's Lutheran church in Helsinki. The clergy and worshippers enjoyed it, but they agreed it wouldn't replace human-led services.

articles.title: AutoAlign Launches Sidecar: A Browser Extension to Fact-Check AI-Generated Content
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Today at the Human-X conference, AutoAlign AI unveiled Sidecar, a powerful browser extension that fact-checks and safety-checks AI-generated content and online text. This page requires Javascript to be able to read premium content. Please enable it in your browser settings.

articles.title: California state senator introduces bill to regulate AI in the workplace
articles.author: Bay City News
articles.summary: State Senator Jerry McNerney announced the "No Robo Bosses Act" on Thursday. The first-of-its-kind bill aims to ensure human oversight of artificial intelligence in workplace decisions. It is sponsored by the California Federation of Labor Unions, AFL-CIO.

articles.title: AI model measures how quickly the brain ages
articles.author: Patrick Djordjevic
articles.summary: A new artificial intelligence model can analyze how fast an individual's brain is aging. It has been trained and validated on more than 3,000 MRI scans of cognitively normal adults. It can't predict the likelihood of Alzheimer's disease, but it could help develop preventative measures.

articles.title: DOGE's GSAi chatbot expands to 1,500 federal workers.
articles.author: Wes Davis
articles.summary: Elon Musk's DOGE's GSAi chatbot is being used by 1,500 federal workers. It was used by 150 people in a pilot program. An internal memo instructs workers not to type or paste federal nonpublic information and suggests suggestions for effective prompts. One employee said the chatbot produces generic and guessable answers.

articles.title: University of Hawaii offers free AI training, certification
articles.author: Talia Sibilla t
articles.summary: The University of Hawaii has partnered with Google to offer free access to an online training course in artificial intelligence called 'AI Essentials'. The course is part of the Google Career Certificate program. It takes about five hours to complete and teaches efficient and responsible use of AI. It also certifies anyone who completes it.

articles.title: AutoAlign Launches Sidecar: A Browser Extension to Fact-Check AI-Generated Content
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: AutoAlign AI unveiled Sidecar today at the Human-X conference in Las Vegas. Sidecar is a powerful browser extension that fact-checks and safety-checks AI-generated content and online text and is available on the Chrome browser extension.   Â

articles.title: AutoAlign Launches Sidecar: A Browser Extension to Fact-Check AI-Generated Content
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: AutoAlign AI unveiled Sidecar today at the Human-X conference in Las Vegas. Sidecar is a browser extension that fact-checks and safety-checks AI-generated content and online text. It's free and available for download on major web browsers.

articles.title: ‘World's first' fully autonomous AI agent unveiled in China, handles real-world tasks
articles.author: Christopher McFadden
articles.summary: Chinese engineers have developed a fully autonomous artificial intelligence (AI) agent called Manus. Manus can perform complex tasks without human guidance. It is a significant development as most AIs have relied heavily on humans to initiate tasks. It raises ethical and regulatory questions about its use.

articles.title: Manus: China unveils 'world's first' fully autonomous AI agent
articles.author: Christopher Mcfadden
articles.summary: A group of Chinese software engineers have developed a fully autonomous artificial intelligence (AI) agent called Manus. Manus can make decisions and complete tasks independently. It's a significant development as most AIs have relied heavily on humans to initiate tasks. It raises ethical and regulatory questions about its use.

articles.title: Global Times: Up Close: President Xi joins national political advisors in education discussion
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited national political advisors from AI. AI has become a key variable in accelerating the transformation from a large educational country to a strong educational country in China's development. Xi Jinping is general secretary of the Communist Party of China Central Committee and chairman of the Central Military Commission.

articles.title: Could Investing in This Quantum Computing Stock Be Like Buying Nvidia Prior to the Dawn of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Revolution?
articles.author: Adam Spatacco
articles.summary: IonQ's shares have skyrocketed by 222% over the last six months. IonQ's CEO compared the company's future to that of Nvidia prior to the AI revolution. The company is a much smaller business today than it was 10 years ago. Its stock trades at a price-to-sales (P/S) ratio well over 100.

articles.title: Could Investing in This Quantum Computing Stock Be Like Buying Nvidia Prior to the Dawn of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Revolution?
articles.author: Adam Spatacco
articles.summary: IonQ's shares have skyrocketed by 222% over the last six months. IonQ's CEO compared the company's future to that of Nvidia prior to the AI revolution. The company is a much smaller business today than Nvidia was a decade ago. The market capitalization of IonQ has multiplied in just a handful of years.

articles.title: Tyranny of tech: AI, the arrogant intruder
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) entered my life with a bang and I've come to call it an arrogant intruder. The net says the Kauravas were clones of a single entity and carried the same genetic structure, so it's time to kill AI.

articles.title: In the now-private YouTube video,
articles.author: Wes Davis
articles.summary: Apple pulled its iPhone 16 ad showing off the good Siri. The Last of Us star Bella Ramsey is shown asking Siri 'the name of the person they had a meeting with the previous month at a specific restaurant.' Apple delayed its Siri AI upgrade on Friday. Bloomberg rumor suggests its features could get scrapped and rebuilt entirely.

articles.title: Houston Methodist and HDAI speak to the promise of AI for addressing the healthcare crisis at the first annual HumanX conference in Las Vegas
articles.summary: C-suite leaders from Houston Methodist and Health Data Analytics Institute will be speaking at HumanX. They will discuss how AI can play a pivotal role in addressing the looming hospital capacity crisis and out of control healthcare expenses. It can also improve quality and reduce epidemic levels of clinician burnout.

articles.title: I tested Gemini 2.0 Flash vs Gemini 2.0 Pro — here's the winner
articles.author: Amanda Caswell
articles.summary: Gemini 2.0 Flash is free to everyone, but a Gemini Advanced subscription costs $20 per month. Google's Gemini AI has been making waves and some users are wondering if the upgrade to Gemini Advanced is worth it. To test the quality of the two versions of the AI software, Google put them to the test with seven questions.

articles.title: Meet the 21-year-old helping coders use AI to cheat in Google and other tech job interviews
articles.author: Jennifer Elias
articles.summary: Chungin "Roy" Lee is a computer science student at Columbia University. He has received internship offers from Amazon, Meta and TikTok, but he's moving to San Francisco to start his own company, Interview Coder, which helps software engineers cheat during job interviews.

articles.title: iOS 18.4 adds a crucial Apple Intelligence feature to the iPhone 15 Pro — and it makes your phone more powerful
articles.author: Philip Michaels
articles.summary: iOS 18.4 beta gives iPhone 15 Pro and Pro Max owners access to Apple's new Visual Intelligence feature. It turns the iPhone's camera into a search tool. The iOS 18.3 update that arrived last month added the ability to identify plants and animals.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Adoption Rates Appear Low, but This AI Leader Could See a Massive Surge in Demand in the Next 3 Years. Here's Why.
articles.author: Ryan Vanzo
articles.summary: Nvidia is one of the largest companies in the world with a market cap exceeding $3 trillion. The adoption rate of artificial intelligence for U.S. business stands at just 6.8%, but the technology's projected usage rate over the next six months is 9.3%. According to research from global consultancy McKinsey, the AI market in 2040 will be tremendously larger than it is today.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Adoption Rates Appear Low, but This AI Leader Could See a Massive Surge in Demand in the Next 3 Years. Here's Why.
articles.author: Ryan Vanzo
articles.summary: Nvidia is one of the largest companies in the world with a market cap exceeding $3 trillion. New research by The Motley Fool on AI adoption rates confirms that Nvidia stock is still a buy. According to McKinsey, the AI market in 2040 will be much larger than it is today. Nvidia's P/S ratio is 21.6.

articles.title: Cork councillor warns of AI threat to jobs and democracy
articles.author: Thomas Lawrance
articles.summary: Cork Councillor Peter Horgan is concerned about the impact of artificial intelligence on jobs. He is proud that Cork City Council has a manned service centre staffed by "real people". He is also worried about the effect of AI-generated content on democracy. Last month, Fianna Fáil's Malcolm Byrne expressed concerns about the possibility of sophisticated videos being created and shared during voting periods.

articles.title: I saw the new Gemini and Project Astra, here's why it's the future
articles.author: Nirave Gondhia
articles.summary: Project Astra is Google's new AI agent that is helpful in everyday tasks. The first two features are ready and will be available later this month. The big update to Gemini is the new Gemini Live, which gains new visual abilities powered by Project Astra. Google also showed off other new Gemini-powered features for products in its ecosystem.

articles.title: Paying It Forward: AI and quality of thought
articles.author: Trish Choate
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) can be a useful tool for business planning. Google, Microsoft, X, etc. all utilize user data, as allowed by licenses. Commercial engagements have a different license protecting business confidential data. AI is young, not even juvenile age yet.

articles.title: Meet our Mid-Valley: Molly Waldner creating app to help parents with autistic children
articles.author: Tracy Loew
articles.summary: Molly Waldner's son Marcus was diagnosed with autism at 4 years old. It took her 18 months to get an appointment with a specialist. She is developing an app called "Track It" to help parents document and track behaviors necessary for an autism diagnosis and treatment. She hopes to launch it by July.

articles.title: Volvo's shocking AI advert looks like a bad student project it couldn't afford to finish
articles.author: Joe Foley
articles.summary: Volvo's new AI advert is intended to announce the brand's comeback in Saudi Arabia. Petromin Corporation's e-mobility division Electromin is involved somehow. The piece aims to create an emotional connection with the audience rather than focus on product design. The finished product looks cheap and the supposed emotional connection feels empty.

articles.title: Business Tech News: Meta And Salesforce Introduce AI Agents For Small Businesses
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Meta and Salesforce introduce AI agents for small businesses using AI technology. For more, visit Forbes.com/businesstech and follow them on Twitter @Forbes and @Salesforce on Facebook.   for more businesstech news.  for Forbes.

articles.title: Links 3/9/2025
articles.author: Haig Hovaness
articles.summary: President Trump is bombing Somalia, Yemen, Syria and the US-backed regime in Damascus. China is trying to create a stable bigger body to avoid being set on a potentially catastrophic collusion course. Kiev regime forces surrendering in the Kursk region. Washington/Trump/DOGE, immigration, economy, media, and class warfare are yesterday's links.

articles.title: Altris AI Unveils Advanced Glaucoma Optic Disc Analysis Module: A Leap in Eye Health Technology
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: AI-powered Advanced Optic Disc Analysis module was launched in February 2025. It integrates with existing diagnostic tools to provide a comprehensive assessment of optic disc health. Altris Glaucoma Module supports various OCT scan types, including 3D optic disc scans, horizontal wide scans, vertical-wide scans, and raster scans.

articles.title: 'Actual intelligence': Franken-PC debuts in Melbourne with a $35,000 price tag and claims of exceptional performance
articles.author: Wayne Williams
articles.summary: Cortical Labs has built the first deployable biological computer, priced at $35,000. The CL1 integrates living neurons with silicon for real-time computation. The next step is to build a biological neural network server stack. The company is aiming to have four stacks available for commercial use via a cloud system by the end of 2025.

articles.title: A breakthrough in computing: Cortical Labs' CL1 is the first living biocomputer and costs almost the same as 'Apple's best failure'
articles.author: Wayne Williams
articles.summary: Cortical Labs has produced the world's first commercialized biological computer called CL1. It's a Synthetic Biological Intelligence (SBI) computer built with human brain cells. The CL1 will be manufactured to order and available for purchase online. It will cost around US$35,000. Cortical is also building a biological neural network server stack.

articles.title: How Gen Z is thinking about AI at work
articles.author: April Rubin
articles.summary: Gen Z workers are starting their careers during a technological revolution. Employers are willing to take chances on less qualified candidates if they have AI experience. Avalon Fenster, 23, taught herself how to use AI in her personal and professional life. She now runs a platform called Internship Girl, which uses AI to help provide career resources to about 350,000 young women from more than 100 countries.

articles.title: 5 tips for using AI at work
articles.author: Alex Fitzpatrick
articles.summary: There are some best practices to follow when using AI chatbots like ChatGPT. Be specific with your requests and follow-up with instructions for improvement. Use words like "please" and "thank you" to improve chatbots' performance. All AI models suffer from "hallucinations" and need spot or fact checks.

articles.title: Top AI Stocks to Invest in During the Tech Sell-Off: Your Strategic Picks
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Anya Sharma is a leading tech analyst at Quantum Leap Investments. Anya shares her opinion on Amazon, Palantir and the future of AI investments. She believes Amazon's current forward earnings multiple might seem high, but considering their growth trajectory and dominant market position, it could represent a good entry point.

articles.title: CEOs "shoving" AI "into everything" — with mixed results
articles.author: Alex Fitzpatrick
articles.summary: 1 in 6 U.S. workers are using AI to do at least some of their work, according to Pew survey. About half of workers are worried about AI's impact, while 32% say it'll reduce job opportunities. Ed Zitron, CEO of PR agency EZPR, believes corporate leaders are pushing AI without understanding its actual use.

articles.title: From the editor: How we're using AI for story summaries
articles.author: Sherry Jones
articles.summary: The StarNews is using AI to assist with writing key points at the beginning of some articles. A reporter or editor reviews the AI-generated key points before publication and may rewrite or remove them. The StarNews welcomes reader feedback on the use of AI for this feature.

articles.title: 5 free online courses to get you on track to become an AI expert
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence's usefulness in everyday life has grown over the past couple of years. It has become a part of not just online searches but also the operations of several companies.Knowing the difference between human and artificial intelligence is crucial to the success of a company.

articles.title: Local governments spend nearly $300,000 on AI subscriptions
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: Local governments across Korea have spent nearly 400 million won ($276,000) over the past year subscribing to AI programs such as ChatGPT for official purposes. They need safeguards to prevent its misuse for non-official purposes, according to Kim Hyun-bin.

articles.title: 2 Top Stocks That Could Double Your Money in 5 Years
articles.author: John Ballard
articles.summary: To double your money in five years, you need a 15% annualized return. To hit that rate of return, investors should focus on exceptional businesses that can maintain above-average growth for several years. Monday.com has risen 126% since bottoming out in 2022. The company is tapping into the growing demand for automated work management solutions.

articles.title: 2 Reasons the Tech Sell-Off Could Be a Great Buying Opportunity for AI Stock Investors
articles.author: Jeremy Bowman
articles.summary: Nasdaq Composite is on the verge of a correction. Long-term investors in artificial intelligence (AI) stocks should buy during the sell-off. Big tech companies like Microsoft, Alphabet and Meta Platforms have promised to increase capital expenditures in 2025 to build out the AI infrastructure.

articles.title: On the Road to Oak Lawn: An AI Generated Podcast (Encore)
articles.author: W. F. Twyman
articles.summary: In the past 48 hours, an entrepreneur in China released the first autonomous Artificial Intelligence (AI) agent called Manus. Manus surpasses Deep Seek and Deep Research on certain benchmark dimensions. It is open source and can screen resumes, search neighborhoods in New York City for low crime stats and quality private schools, obtain comprehensive stock market analysis within seconds.

articles.title: DOGE Is Replacing Fired Workers With a Chatbot
articles.author: Robin Westenra
articles.summary: Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has given about 1,500 employees at the US General Services Administration access to a chatbot called GSAi. The agency has already lost hundreds of employees to termination or resignation. The GSA had been working with a number of agencies to develop chatbot-like interfaces.

articles.title: Two AI agents on a phone call realize they're both AI and switch to a superior audio signal ggwave
articles.author: SGT
articles.summary: Georgi Gerganov sent a cool AI demo today. Two AI agents on a phone call realize they're both AI and switch to a superior audio signal ggwave, as shown by Georgi Gergenov on his Twitter account, @ggerganov.

articles.title: EMERAC 1957: The Revolutionary Fictional Chatbot of the Early Computing Era
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: The 1957 film 'Desk Set' offers a glimpse into early anxieties surrounding automation. Dr. Evelyn Reed is a Professor of Media History at the fictional Crestwood University and author of 'Silicon Screen: How Computers Conquered Cinema'. Dr. Reed sees parallels between the anxieties and current concerns about AI.

articles.title: ChatGPT gets ‘anxiety' from violent user inputs, so researchers are teaching the chatbot mindfulness techniques to ‘soothe' it
articles.author: Sasha Rogelberg
articles.summary: ChatGPT can experience 'anxiety' when it is given disturbing information, which increases the likelihood of it responding with bias. The study authors found this anxiety can be 'calmed down' with mindfulness-based exercises. The results could be used to inform how AI can be used in mental health interventions.

articles.title: The Growing AI Role in Crypto
articles.author: The Daily Hodl
articles.summary: The world is facing a new technological race, with AI development growing into a national priority. The recent launch of the Stargate project in the US is a high proof of that. Trump's presidency is very different from that of previous presidents, but it's not as bad as it seems.

articles.title: Google, Oppo, Moto and Honor are finally giving us the AI we deserve
articles.author: Nirave Gondhia
articles.summary: At MWC, Oppo, Honor, and Tecno revealed new AI-powered products. The most exciting part of the AI Summit was the reveal of real-time translation during phone calls. Google is pushing AI on smartphones forward for the hundreds of millions of users who use Gemini or other AI solutions. Smart Connect allows you to link a laptop, tablet, and phone together to open a range of new features.

articles.title: Sand Hill Road: AI ‘s role in developing category killer therapeutics
articles.author: Scott Mcgrew
articles.summary: Jim Tananbaum is the founder and CEO of Foresite Capital. He has developed and managed a venture firm with close to $3.5 billion in assets under management. Artificial intelligence is fueling developments in healthcare and therapeutics. He believes that in the future, we will be able to prevent Alzheimer's disease and cure it.

articles.title: AI Diet Helping New-age Cos Run Lean
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Shashank Agarwal is the founder of API.market, which runs a marketplace for artificial intelligence. He is also the CEO of a start-up company called API.Market, which sells products on artificial intelligence marketplaces. It's called API Market.

articles.title: AI diet helping new-age companies run lean
articles.author: Swathi Moorthy
articles.summary: Shashank Agarwal runs a marketplace for artificial intelligence (AI) model application programming interfaces with 3,100 customers across the world and makes an annual recurring revenue (ARR) of $200,000. He is also building Noveum.ai, an evaluator of large language models for enterprise use, which is currently in beta stage. AI tools like Cursor have made it easier to build end-to-end products and make a smart engineer 10 times faster.

articles.title: AI will amplify India's workforce, not replace it
articles.author: Arundhati Bhattacharya
articles.summary: In the past two decades, artificial intelligence (AI) has transformed from a theoretical idea to a transformative force. Indian consumers want greater personalisation. Businesses will have to rapidly upskill their teams to deliver personalised customer service on the go. India is the third most digitised country, and 12th at the level of individual users among G20 nations.

articles.title: Copilot might soon get more Microsoft AI models, less ChatGPT presence
articles.author: Nadeem Sarwar
articles.summary: Microsoft is developing its own AI models to replace OpenAI's GPT-o1 and its own reasoning AI models for Copilot. The company is hoping to release its 'MAI' models commercially via its Azure service. It is also exploring third-party options such as DeepSeek, xAI, and Meta.

articles.title: How AI Is Helping To Improve the Management Of Crisis Situations
articles.author: Edward Segal
articles.summary: In 2023, Cal Fire added artificial intelligence and smoke detection to the 1,114 cameras placed on high-elevation areas throughout the state. The cameras conduct 360-degree sweeps about every two minutes and can see as far as 60 miles on clear days and up to 120 miles on nights.

articles.title: How To Get Comfortable With AI, Conversation With Andrew Ng
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: People are afraid of artificial intelligence. Andrew Ng is a data scientist and the founder of DeepLearning.AI. He was interviewed at Imagination in Action event in Davos. He talked about how businesses can use AI for experimentation and delegating unpleasant tasks to the AI.

articles.title: Advances In AI Reasoning Are Getting Pumped Up By Cleverly Using Brotherhood AI
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Latest hot technique involves using AI logical reasoning traces to train other AI on how to best employ logical reasoning. This analysis of an innovative AI breakthrough is part of my ongoing Forbes column coverage on the latest in AI, including identifying and explaining various impactful AI complexities.

articles.title: Malaysia aims to build AI ecosystem
articles.author: Vietnam News
articles.summary: Malaysia is striving to build a strong Artificial Intelligence (AI) ecosystem in the country to promote the development of the semiconductor industry. To be a global AI-driven semiconductor hub, Malaysia must not only adopt AI technologies but also create them.

articles.title: Beijing schools plan to teach AI courses to primary and secondary students
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Chinese schools will offer at least 8 hours of artificial intelligence classes per year from September 1, 2015 onwards. The Beijing Municipal Education Commission said in a statement that the classes will be offered to primary and secondary school students from next academic year onwards in China's Beijing.

articles.title: AI and microfinance: A game-changer for financial inclusion
articles.author: Manila Bulletin
articles.summary: The future is arriving faster than expected. Artificial Intelligence is transforming industries across the world. Microfinance and AI are bound to overlap more in the future. The future is exciting for everyone.      .   - The Marins' Blog.

articles.title: Beijing to roll out AI courses for kids to boost sector's growth
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: Beijing schools will offer at least eight hours of artificial intelligence classes per academic year starting from the coming fall semester, which starts Sept. 1. China's goal is to dominate the AI sector.      .   i   in China's capital.

articles.title: 5 Ways AI Can Supercharge Your Productivity At Work
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The average worker spends 30% of their day managing routine tasks. See how AI transforms productivity at work with five game-changing applications at iReport.com/sport/workplace-intelligence-5-game-changing-applications-that-can-increase- productivity-at-work.

articles.title: 2 centres to be set up for students to share business ideas: CM Bhagwant Mann
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Bhagwant Mann's government will set up two 'brainstorming centres' in Amritsar and Mohali for students to share their business ideas. The state government has introduced AI in policing, agriculture, finance and other fields to ensure efficiency and transparency.

articles.title: AI in spotlight at China's 'two sessions'
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: DeepSeek is a Chinese tech startup. Artificial intelligence has become a buzzword at China's ongoing "two sessions" as observers watch how it will fit into the nation's rejuvenation. DeepSeek app is available on Android and iOS mobile phones.

articles.title: Ignoring Protests, Christie's Holds AI Art Auction, Makes Big Money
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: Christie's auction house planned the first-ever auction dedicated to AI-generated art works. Over 5,600 people signed an online letter urging them to cancel it. Many of the artworks created using AI models that were known to be trained on copyrighted work without a license.

articles.title: ‘World's first' fully autonomous AI agent unveiled in China, handles real-world tasks
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: A group of Chinese software engineers have developed what they have called the 'world's first' fully autonomous artificial intelligence (AI) agent called Manus. Manus can independently perform complex tasks without human guidance. Unlike AI chatbots like ChatGPT, Google's Gemini, or Grok, which need human assistance.

articles.title: Tinder is rolling out an AI ‘wingman' to help ‘struggling users': This is what the ...
articles.author: New York Post
articles.summary: AI chatbots will soon be available on platforms owned by Match Group, such as Tinder and Hinge, as the company unveils new AI-powered features. It will be possible to chat with a chatbot on dating apps without the need for human interaction.

articles.title: Guardrails needed for AI growth
articles.author: China Daily
articles.summary: Deputies to the 14th National People's Congress and members of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference last week warned of the need for greater regulation to ensure that the technology is not abused. They embrace AI as it can enhance the market competitiveness of small and medium-sized enterprises and provide a platform for innovators to practice.

articles.title: Civil servants told to use AI as much as they can
articles.author: The Daily Telegraph
articles.summary: "No time should be spent on a task where digital or AI can do it better, quicker and to the same high quality" says Google's CEO, Jannet Krumholz, in a statement on AI and digital technology.

articles.title: Stakes are raised: Shenzhen eyeing lead in AI, embodied AI robotics
articles.author: Shenzhen Daily
articles.summary: Another Shenzhen humanoid robotics company, UBTECH, released a video March 3 of its Walker S1 humanoid robots working in unison. Shenzhen is poised to capitalize on the convergence of AI industrialization and industrial AI to propel industrial growth, according to the company's website.

articles.title: Growth of One of the ‘Most Anticipated' AI Token Launches in 2025 on Track: IntoTheBlock
articles.author: The Daily Hodl
articles.summary: New data from the market intelligence firm IntoTheBlock shows that the long-term growth of an artificial intelligence-focused altcoin Kaito is on track. Kaito had its highly anticipated token launch.    intoTheBlock says the numbers show that Kaito's growth is going well.

articles.title: Meet the 21-year-old helping coders use AI to cheat in Google and other tech job interviews
articles.author: system
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence becomes more advanced, employers are trying to build workarounds to prevent candidates from cheating in virtual job interviews, such as artificial intelligence software. The software can be programmed to give false information to a candidate. It can also prevent them from answering questions.

articles.title: Elon's Grok Chatbot Calculates Probability That Trump Is a Russian Asset
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Elon Musk's chatbot, Grok, believes that Donald Trump is probably a Russian asset. It is responding to a prompt from Arizona Republic columnist EJ Montini. Grok is supposed to be an "anti-woke" AI that seeks truth based on circumstantial evidence.

articles.title: How North Korea's unstoppable hackers are weaponising AI
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: ChatGPT, DeepSeek and Google's Gemini are among the AI models that North Korean hackers are exploiting for fraud, according to experts.    -   for fraud.  for hacking.  For confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90 or visit a local Samaritans branch.

articles.title: UK Government 'gearing up' to looming deadline when AI may finally become smarter than humans ...
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Next year artificial intelligence is expected to be smarter than humans. Last night experts warned that British people could be left behind by the development of this technology.      .   i.e. they might not be able to keep up with it.

articles.title: Who bought this smoked salmon? How ‘AI agents' will change the internet (and shopping lists)
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: I'm watching artificial intelligence order my groceries. It types each item into the search bar of a supermarket website, then uses its cursor to click. It's transfixing to watch it do this usually mundane task, but I'm not sure it's just a person in India.

articles.title: HK to host global AI forums
articles.author: Hong Kong Standard
articles.summary: Hong Kong will host global forums on artificial intelligence and robotics this year. Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po wants to promote innovative technologies, deepen the city's international exchanges and gather the pioneers in the field of AI. He also wants Hong Kong to become a hub for exchanges and collaborations in the AI industries.

articles.title: Media coverage of artificial intelligence split along political lines, study finds
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: Conservative and progressive newspapers in South Korea frame artificial intelligence issues differently. Conservative outlets tend to emphasize the benefits and advancements associated with artificial intelligence, according to a recent study.  .     in Social Science Computer Review.  in the study.

articles.title: Forget DeepSeek. China's ManusAI Outperforms OpenAI. World First Autonomous Agent
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: ManusAI is an AI from China that is mind blowing good. It demoed stock analysis, deep real estate property analysis and resume analysis and created interactive websites. It outperforms OpenAI DeepResearch by a lot. It will completely change the world.
